stories.title: Qubits Can Be as Safe as Bits, Researchers Show

stories.text:
I'm trying to figure out how to deploy my side project but I'm no devops pro (just an eager learner). My stack is node + postgres. I'd love to have a nice CI/CD pipeline so I'm curious what others have found successful at this scale.

It seems as though caprover and dokku are in this kind of space. I've also considered k8s/k3s but it seems overbearing. I'm experimenting with docker swarm mode, which seems more manageable. Just looking for recommendations.
stories.title: Ask HN: How do you deploy your solo-dev webapp?
Researchers discover Log4j-like flaw in H2 database console
Faster Checkouts Could Reduce Virus Spread in Stores

stories.text:
Presumably your day job is writing code.

Other than writing code, what practices, routines, systems, or otherwise... do YOU use to maximize your output (ship more code)? These could be wholly unrelated to software, or maybe not.

Strict morning routine?

Fulfilling hobby?

Coffee habit?

Diet?

Sleep?

Medication?

Music?

Pomodoro?

TDD?

Read software blogs?

Study/Memorize APIs?

What works for YOU on a day-to-day basis to help you get into a highly productive flow?
stories.title: Ask HN: Other than writing code, how do YOU maximize your output?
